Desc.entry: Patients can see an experienced NHS nurse without an appointment. They should report to and book in at Reception for a consultation. Services provided include treatment of minor illness, advice on health issues, sexual health and contraception advice, emergency contraception, advice on self treatment where appropriate and a comprehensive assessment of symptoms. Makes referrals as appropriate and has access to a range of health information materials. Nurses are able to prescribe a range of medication if clinically indicated. The following services are not available: phlebotomy, ear syringing and repeat prescriptions. Patients should consult their own GP for these services. Self or any referral.
